Description: Carved and painted(worn) wooden shabti with a blue lappet-wig, a modelled face, a collar and painted red hands holding red hoes; the front of the leg section is inscribed with black painted Hieroglyphs(very worn); the back is decorated with a representation of a red seed-basket and bandaging.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
